info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued September 09 at 1:59PM EDT until September 11 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Heavy rain possible in the southern and western Piedmont... .Pockets of moderate to heavy rain are possible over the weekend, especially late Saturday afternoon into Saturday night. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Watch for a portion of central North Carolina, including the following areas, Alamance, Anson, Davidson, Forsyth, Guilford, Montgomery, Randolph, Richmond, and Stanly. * From Saturday afternoon through Sunday evening. * Deep moisture flowing into the region combined with a warm front moving in from the south and southeast will bring a threat of widespread rain to southern and western portions of the Piedmont Saturday through Sunday. Rainfall totals around 2 inches are likely, with the potential for isolated storm total rainfall of 3 to 4 inches. The risk of flooding will be highest in urban areas.
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION. You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
